titleStmt.title: By the King: a proclamation. James R. Whereas Richard now Duke of Tyrconnell our late Deputy of this kingdome, upon breaking out of the present rebellion in several parts of this realm, ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook and Samuel Helsham, assigns of Benjamin Tooke printer to the King's most excellent Majesty; and are to be sold at his Majesties printing-house on Ormonde-Key, and the Colledg-Arms in Castle-street.,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption title and opening lines of text.
"Given at our court at our castle of Dublin, the 20th day of July 1689."
All protestants to give up their arms. Cf. Steele.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
